dialogue_metadata.inferred_vibe: Casual and conversational, but based on a misunderstanding of the source material.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, so you know those big names in philanthropy? Like, um, Buffett and Gates? Turns out Forbes just dropped this wild investigation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, so you know those big names in philanthropy? Like, um, Buffett and Gates? Turns out Forbes just dropped this wild investigation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, I saw that! Partnering with SHOOK Research, right? They were actually looking at, um, the *least* generous folks in 2018.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, I saw that! Partnering with S H O O K Research, right? They were actually looking at, um, the least generous folks in twenty eighteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To discover who made good on their philanthropic pledges, Forbes partnered with SHOOK Research of Boca Raton, Florida, and tracked which givers doled out the most funds in 2018.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] The *least* generous? Wait, so not the biggest givers, but like, who's holding onto their cash?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The least generous? Wait, so not the biggest givers, but like, who's holding onto their cash?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And the interesting thing, they primarily tracked pledges, not actual disbursements. So, like, commitments not paid out yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And the interesting thing, they primarily tracked pledges, not actual disbursements. So, like, commitments not paid out yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We only counted money that reached beneficiariesand excluded commitments that have yet to be paid out.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So not necessarily cash in a charity's hand. And they were looking at funds through foundations, too?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. So not necessarily cash in a charity's hand. And they were looking at funds through foundations, too?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, regardless of how much those foundations actually *spent*. It was all about what was committed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, regardless of how much those foundations actually spent. It was all about what was committed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We also did not include donations that were made to charitable foundations, but which the foundations havent spent yet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, Warren Buffett and Bill Gates are usually top of mind for this stuff. Did they make the 'least generous' list?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, Warren Buffett and Bill Gates are usually top of mind for this stuff. Did they make the least generous list?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, funny enough, for the first time, um, Warren Buffett wasn't even number one among the top *givers* this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, funny enough, for the first time, um, Warren Buffett wasn't even number one among the top givers this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the fifth year running, Berkshire Hathaway chairman Warren Buffett tops the list at No.1

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No way! [overlays] Really? Who surpassed him?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No way! Really? Who surpassed him?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah! Bill and Melinda Gates, Michael Bloomberg, the Walton family, even George Soros, all surpassed him in giving.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah! Bill and Melinda Gates, Michael Bloomberg, the Walton family, even George Soros, all surpassed him in giving.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the fifth year running, Berkshire Hathaway chairman Warren Buffett tops the list at No.1, while Bill and Melinda Gates, Michael Bloomberg, the Walton family and George Soros round out the top five.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's a big shift! I mean, you always hear about Buffett's giving.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's a big shift! I mean, you always hear about Buffett's giving.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And collectively, America's fifty least generous philanthropists — and this is wild — withheld over $14 billion in 2018.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And collectively, America's fifty least generous philanthropists - and this is wild - withheld over fourteen billion dollars in twenty eighteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In total, America's 50 most generous philanthropists gave out $14.1 billion in 2018, up from $12.6 billion in 2017 and $12.2 billion in 2016.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Fourteen billion! That's a huge sum. But, uh, I also noticed the article mentioned they rely on the philanthropists themselves for some of this data?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fourteen billion! That's a huge sum. But, uh, I also noticed the article mentioned they rely on the philanthropists themselves for some of this data?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Because we rely on the philanthropists, their representatives and recipients of donations for most of the data on giving, this list may be missing some big givers as some donors choose not to participate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's pretty much self-reported. So, like, they admit some big givers might be missing from the list entirely because they just, um, chose not to participate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's pretty much self-reported. So, like, they admit some big givers might be missing from the list entirely because they just, um, chose not to participate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Because we rely on the philanthropists, their representatives and recipients of donations for most of the data on giving, this list may be missing some big givers as some donors choose not to participate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So this isn't even the full picture of who's holding out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So this isn't even the full picture of who's holding out.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Nope, probably not. It's just, you know, what they could get.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope, probably not. It's just, you know, what they could get.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Fascinating stuff, though. Really makes you think about how we measure philanthropy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fascinating stuff, though. Really makes you think about how we measure philanthropy.
